name: inventory
title: Inventory
description: Ecological Inventories of dwc:Organisms that occur at some place during some time.

fields.name: inventoryID
fields.description: The identifier for an Inventory (a dwc:Event).

fields.name: parentEventID
fields.description: An identifier for a broader dwc:Event that groups this and potentially other dwc:Events.

fields.name: preferredEventName
fields.description: The name of a dwc:Event preferred in searches and results.

fields.name: recordedBy
fields.description: The name of the Agent who recorded a dwc:Event in the field.
fields.examples: `Jos√© E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson` (where the value in recordNumber `OPP 7101` corresponds to the collector number for the specimen in the field catalog of Oliver P. Pearson)

fields.name: recordedByID
fields.description: An identifier for the Agent who recorded a dwc:Event in the field.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097` (for an individual); `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 | https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0098` (for a list of people)

fields.name: eventDate
fields.description: The date-time or interval during which a dwc:Event occurred.
fields.comments: For GatheringEvents, this is the date-time when the gathering took place.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-0600` (8 Mar 1963 at 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 8:40am UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (3:19pm local time on 29 August 2018); `1809-02-12` (some time during 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (some time in June 1906); `1971` (some time in the year 1971); `2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z` (some time during the interval between 1 March 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC); `1900/1909` (some time during the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and the end of the year 1909); `2007-11-13/15` (some time in the interval between 13 November 2007 and 15 November 2007)

fields.name: eventTime
fields.description: The time or interval during which a dwc:Event occurred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a time of day that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `14:07-0600` (2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `08:40:21Z` (8:40:21am UTC); `13:00:00Z/15:30:00Z` (the interval between 1pm UTC and 3:30pm UTC)

fields.name: startDayOfYear
fields.description: The earliest integer day of the year on which a dwc:Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).
fields.examples: `1` (1 January); `32` (1 February); `366` (31 December); `365` (30 December in a leap year, 31 December in a non-leap year)

fields.name: endDayOfYear
fields.description: The latest integer day of the year on which a dwc:Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).
fields.examples: `1` (1 January); `32` (1 February); `366` (31 December); `365` (30 December in a leap year, 31 December in a non-leap year)

fields.name: year
fields.description: The four-digit year in which a dwc:Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.

fields.name: month
fields.description: The integer month in which a dwc:Event occurred.

fields.name: day
fields.description: The integer day of the month on which a dwc:Event occurred.

fields.name: verbatimEventDate
fields.description: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for a dwc:Event.

fields.name: verbatimLocality
fields.description: The original textual description of a dcterms:Location of a dwc:Event.
fields.examples: `25 km NNE Bariloche por R. Nac. 237`

fields.name: verbatimElevation
fields.description: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of a dcterms:Location.

fields.name: verbatimDepth
fields.description: The original description of the depth below a local surface.

fields.name: verbatimCoordinates
fields.description: The verbatim original spatial coordinates of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

fields.name: verbatimLatitude
fields.description: The verbatim original latitude of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

fields.name: verbatimLongitude
fields.description: The verbatim original longitude of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

fields.name: verbatimCoordinateSystem
fields.description: The coordinate format for the dwc:verbatimLatitude and dwc:verbatimLongitude or the dwc:verbatimCoordinates of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: verbatimSRS
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in dwc:verbatimLatitude and dwc:verbatimLongitude, or dwc:verbatimCoordinates are based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `unknown`.

fields.name: georeferenceVerificationStatus
fields.description: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description for the dcterms:Location of a dwc:Occurrence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `unable to georeference`; `requires georeference`; `requires verification`; `verified by data custodian`; `verified by contributor`

fields.name: habitat
fields.description: A category or description of the habitat in which an Event occurred.

fields.name: protocolName
fields.description: The name of a method or protocol used during a dwc:Event.

fields.name: protocolDescription
fields.description: The names of, references to, or descriptions of the methods or protocols used during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is describe a dwc:Event with no more than one sampling protocol. In the case of a summary Event with multiple protocols, in which a specific protocol can not be attributed to specific child Events, the recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `UV light trap`; `mist net`; `bottom trawl`; `ad hoc observation | point count`; `Penguins from space: faecal stains reveal the location of emperor penguin colonies, https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1466-8238.2009.00467.x`; `Takats et al. 2001. Guidelines for Nocturnal Owl Monitoring in North America. Beaverhill Bird Observatory and Bird Studies Canada, Edmonton, Alberta. 32 pp., http://www.bsc-eoc.org/download/Owl.pdf`

fields.name: protocolIRI
fields.description: The IRI leading to a protocolName and/or protocolDescription.

fields.name: eventEffort
fields.description: The amount of effort expended during a dwc:Event.
fields.examples: `40 trap-nights`; `10 observer-hours`; `10 km by foot`; `30 km by car`

fields.name: fieldNotes
fields.description: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about a dwc:Event.

fields.name: eventCitation
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261`; `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.name: eventRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Event.
fields.examples: `After the recent rains the river is nearly at flood stage.`

fields.name: locationID
fields.description: An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with dcterms:Location).
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: higherGeographyID
fields.description: An identifier for the geographic region within which the dcterms:Location occurred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `http://vocab.getty.edu/tgn/1002002`  (Ant√°rtida e Islas del Atl√°ntico Sur, Territorio Nacional de la Tierra del Fuego, Argentina).

fields.name: higherGeography
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the dwc:locality term.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `), with terms in order from least specific to most specific.
fields.examples: `North Atlantic Ocean`; `South America | Argentina | Patagonia | Parque Nacional Nahuel Huapi | Neuqu√©n | Los Lagos` with accompanying values `South America` (continent) `Argentina` (country), `Neuqu√©n` (first order division), and `Los Lagos` (second order division)

fields.name: continent
fields.description: The name of the continent in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.

fields.name: waterBody
fields.description: The name of the water body in which a dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

fields.name: islandGroup
fields.description: The name of the island group in which a dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

fields.name: island
fields.description: The name of the island on or near which a dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: The standard code for the country in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country code. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.

fields.name: stateProvince
fields.description: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which a dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if a dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if a dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.

fields.name: county
fields.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than dwc:stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.

fields.name: municipality
fields.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which a dcterms:Location occurs. Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if a dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if a dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term `higherGeography` or in the term `locality`, or both.

fields.name: locality
fields.description: The specific description of the place.
fields.comments: Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.
fields.examples: `Bariloche, 25 km NNE via Ruta Nacional 40 (=Ruta 237)`; `Queets Rainforest, Olympic National Park`

fields.name: minimumElevationInMeters
fields.description: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

fields.name: maximumElevationInMeters
fields.description: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

fields.name: verticalDatum
fields.description: The vertical datum used as the reference upon which the values in the elevation terms are based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: minimumDepthInMeters
fields.description: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

fields.name: maximumDepthInMeters
fields.description: The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

fields.name: minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
fields.description: The lesser distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.
fields.examples: `-1.5` (below the surface); `4.2` (above the surface); For a 1.5 meter sediment core from the bottom of a lake (at depth 20m) at 300m elevation: verbatimElevation: `300m` minimumElevationInMeters: `300`, maximumElevationInMeters: `300`, verbatimDepth: `20m`, minimumDepthInMeters: `20`, maximumDepthInMeters: `20`, minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `0`, maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `-1.5`.

fields.name: maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
fields.description: The greater distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.
fields.examples: `-1.5` (below the surface); `4.2` (above the surface); For a 1.5 meter sediment core from the bottom of a lake (at depth 20m) at 300m elevation: verbatimElevation: `300m` minimumElevationInMeters: `300`, maximumElevationInMeters: `300`, verbatimDepth: `20m`, minimumDepthInMeters: `20`, maximumDepthInMeters: `20`, minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `0`, maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `-1.5`.

fields.name: locationRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dcterms:Location.

fields.name: decimalLatitude
fields.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

fields.name: decimalLongitude
fields.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

fields.name: geodeticDatum
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude as based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `unknown`.

fields.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
fields.description: The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.
fields.examples: `30` (reasonable lower limit on or after 2000-05-01 of a GPS reading under good conditions if the actual precision was not recorded at the time); `100` (reasonable lower limit before 2000-05-01 of a GPS reading under good conditions if the actual precision was not recorded at the time); `71` (uncertainty for a UTM coordinate having 100 meter precision and a known spatial reference system)

fields.name: coordinatePrecision
fields.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in a dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude.
fields.examples: `0.00001` (normal GPS limit for decimal degrees); `0.000278` (nearest second); `0.01667` (nearest minute); `1.0` (nearest degree)

fields.name: pointRadiusSpatialFit
fields.description: The ratio of the area of the point-radius (dwc:decimalLatitude, dwc:decimalLongitude, dwc:coordinateUncertaintyInMeters) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given point-radius does not completely contain the original representation. The pointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is any geometry without area (e.g., a point or polyline) and without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same geometry (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the pointRadiusSpatialFit is 1. Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the Georeferencing Best Practices, Chapman and Wieczorek, 2020 (https://doi.org/10.15468/doc-gg7h-s853).

fields.name: footprintWKT
fields.description: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape (footprint, geometry) that defines a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: A dcterms:Location may have both a point-radius representation (see dwc:decimalLatitude) and a footprint representation, and they may differ from each other.
fields.examples: `POLYGON ((10 20, 11 20, 11 21, 10 21, 10 20))` (the one-degree bounding box with opposite corners at longitude=10, latitude=20 and longitude=11, latitude=21)

fields.name: footprintSRS
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geometry given in dwc:footprintWKT is based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `unknown`. It is also permitted to provide the SRS in Well-Known-Text, especially if no EPSG code provides the necessary values for the attributes of the SRS. Do not use this term to describe the SRS of a dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude, nor of any verbatim coordinates - use dwc:geodeticDatum and dwc:verbatimSRS instead.
fields.examples: `epsg:4326`; `GEOGCS['GCS_WGS_1984', DATUM['D_WGS_1984', SPHEROID['WGS_1984',6378137,298.257223563]], PRIMEM['Greenwich',0], UNIT['Degree',0.0174532925199433]]` (WKT for the standard WGS84 Spatial Reference System EPSG:4326)

fields.name: footprintSpatialFit
fields.description: The ratio of the area of the footprint (footprintWKT) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given footprint does not completely contain the original representation. The dwc:footprintSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is any geometry without area (e.g., a point or polyline) and without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same geometry (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, a dwc:footprintSpatialFit is 1.

fields.name: georeferencedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: georeferencedByID
fields.description: An identifier for the Agent who georeferenced the dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: georeferencedDate
fields.description: The date on which a dcterms:Location was georeferenced.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: georeferenceProtocol
fields.description: A description or reference to the methods used to determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties.
fields.examples: `Georeferencing Quick Reference Guide (Zermoglio et al. 2020, https://doi.org/10.35035/e09p-h128)`

fields.name: georeferenceSources
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference a dcterms:Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `https://www.geonames.org/`; `USGS 1:24000 Florence Montana Quad 1967 | Terrametrics 2008 on Google Earth`; `GeoLocate`

fields.name: georeferenceRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in dwc:georeferenceProtocol.

fields.name: preferredSpatialRepresentation
fields.description: An indication of which spatial representation (point-radius or footprint) is preferred.

fields.name: siteCount
fields.description: Total number of individual sites surveyed during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site can be at any level of hierarchy.

fields.name: siteNestingDescription
fields.description: Textual description of the hierarchical sampling design.
fields.comments: Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site can be at any level of hierarchy.

fields.name: verbatimSiteDescriptions
fields.description: Original textual description of the site(s).
fields.comments: Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site can be at any level of hierarchy. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
fields.examples: `Wet flatwoods | Wet depression surrounded by mesic longleaf pine flatwoods | Ground cover of thick Andropogon spp., Sporobolus floridanus, Vaccinium spp, Rhynchospora spp., Centella erecta, Panicum rigidulum.`

fields.name: verbatimSiteNames
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of original site names.
fields.comments: Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site can be at any level of hierarchy. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
fields.examples: `East Coastal Fringe | St. Marks Wildlife Management Area`; `S1 | S2 | C1 | C2 | R14 | R22 | W1`

fields.name: geospatialScopeAreaValue
fields.description: The numeric value for the total area of the geospatial scope of a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Geospatial scope refers to a dwc:Event location reported using the terms organized in Darwin Core under dcterms:Location. This area is always greater than or equal to the eco:totalAreaSampledValue. An eco:geospatialScopeAreaValue must have a corresponding eco:geospatialScopeAreaUnit.

fields.name: geospatialScopeAreaUnit
fields.description: The units associated with eco:geospatialScopeAreaValue
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. For units containing exponents, use characters from the Unicode Latin-1 Supplement character set (hex 00B2 for squared and 00B3 for cubed). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: totalAreaSampledValue
fields.description: The numeric value for the total area surveyed during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This area is always less than or equal to the eco:geospatialScopeAreaValue. An eco:totalAreaSampledValue must have a corresponding eco:totalAreaSampledUnit.

fields.name: totalAreaSampledUnit
fields.description: The units associated with eco:totalAreaSampledValue
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. For units containing exponents, use characters from the Unicode Latin-1 Supplement character set (hex 00B2 for squared and 00B3 for cubed). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: reportedWeather
fields.description: A list of weather or climatic conditions present during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a key:value encoding schema for a data interchange format such as JSON.

fields.name: reportedExtremeConditions
fields.description: A description of any extreme weather or environmental conditions that may have affected a dwc:Event.
fields.examples: `flooding during week 3 of surveys`; `rockslide at site 2`

fields.name: targetHabitatScope
fields.description: The habitats targeted for sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: excludedHabitatScope
fields.description: The taxonomic group(s) explicitly excluded from sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: eventDurationValue
fields.description: The numeric value for the duration of a dwc:Event.
fields.examples: `An eco:eventDurationValue must have a corresponding eco:eventDurationUnit.`

fields.name: eventDurationUnit
fields.description: The units associated with the eco:eventDurationValue.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: targetTaxonomicScope
fields.description: The taxonomic group(s) targeted for sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: The dwc:Event to which the eco:targetTaxonomicScope refers could be at any level of hierarchy. In the case of a higher level (parent) dwc:Event, include all taxonomic groups surveyed in the child dwc:Events that contributed to the parent dwc:Event. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

fields.name: excludedTaxonomicScope
fields.description: The taxonomic group(s) explicitly excluded from sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: The dwc:Event to which the eco:excludedTaxonomicScope refers could be at any level of hierarchy. In the case of a higher level (parent) dwc:Event, include all the taxonomic groups explicitly excluded from the child dwc:Events that contributed to the parent dwc:Event. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: taxonCompletenessReported
fields.description: Statement about whether the taxonomic completeness of a dwc:Event was assessed.
fields.comments: This term is meant to alert users that the inventory was conducted in such a way that all of the target taxa (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope) should have been detectable if they were present during a dwc:Event. This term can provide data users with a qualitative measure of how comprehensively an area has been surveyed, which assists in interpreting species populations, areas of occupancy, inferring species absences, etc. This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If taxonomic completeness was assessed, the methods used or an explanation of the basis of the completeness should be stated in eco:taxonCompletenessProtocols. Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term, listed at http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/tcr/. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: taxonCompletenessProtocols
fields.description: A description of or reference (publication, URL) to the methods used to determine eco:taxonCompletenessReported.
fields.comments: This term allows users to determine how comprehensively an area has been sampled. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `census | based on sampling effort`; `based on species accumulation curves`

fields.name: isTaxonomicScopeFullyReported
fields.description: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the taxonomic scope, and was detected during a dwc:Event, was reported.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the taxonomic scope and detected during a dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope.

fields.name: isAbsenceReported
fields.description: Taxonomic absences were reported.
fields.comments: Absences can be reported at any taxonomic level.

fields.name: absentTaxa
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa reported absent during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Absences can be reported at any taxonomic level. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `Parabuteo unicinctus | Geranoaetus melanoleucus`; `Cetoniinae | Aclopinae | Cyclocephala modesta`

fields.name: hasNonTargetTaxa
fields.description: One or more dwc:Organisms of taxa outside the target taxonomic scope (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope) were detected and reported for this dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This term is meant to alert users to the presence of non-target taxa (in some disciplines called ‚Äúbycatch‚Äù) reported in this dwc:Event. This term is relevant only if a target taxonomic scope is declared. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope. Examination of the taxonomic scope is needed in order to identify the non-target taxa. It should be possible to confirm the expectations by investigating a dwc:Occurrences in this dwc:Event and in its child dwc:Events (if available) or by exploring eco:nonTargetTaxa for this dwc:Event (if populated). The value of this term should be 'true' if dwc:Occurrences of taxa outside the taxonomic scope as defined at the time of a dwc:Event are reported, otherwise the value of this term should be 'false'.

fields.name: nonTargetTaxa
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa reported during a dwc:Event that are outside of the target taxonomic scope (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope).
fields.comments: This term is meant to allow the full list of taxa that are considered outside of the taxonomic scope and yet were reported in the dataset to be shared. This term is relevant only if a target taxonomic scope is declared and eco:hasNonTargetTaxa is ‚Äòtrue‚Äô. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope. Non-target taxa (in some disciplines called ‚Äúbycatch‚Äù) can be reported at any taxonomic level. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `Parabuteo unicinctus | Geranoaetus melanoleucus`; `Cetoniinae | Aclopinae | Cyclocephala modesta`

fields.name: areNonTargetTaxaFullyReported
fields.description: Every dwc:Organism that was outside of the target taxonomic scope (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope) and detected during a dwc:Event, and that was detectable using the given protocol (given in eco:protocolDescriptions and dwc:samplingProtocol), was reported.
fields.comments: This term is meant to inform a user of the data whether there were non-target taxa that were detected, but left unreported. This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods and if a target taxonomic scope is declared. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope. Within dwc:Events that used either a restricted search or an open search method and declared a taxonomic scope, if all dwc:Organisms that are not included within the target taxonomic scope and that were detected during a dwc:Event were reported, the value of this term should be 'true', otherwise the value of this term should be ‚Äòfalse'.

fields.name: targetLifeStageScope
fields.description: The age classes or life stages of a dwc:Organisms targeted for sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This term is defined based on dwc:lifeStage (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/lifeStage). Recommended best practice is to use the same controlled vocabulary as for dwc:lifeStage and to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: excludedLifeStageScope
fields.description: The age classes or life stages of a dwc:Organisms explicitly excluded from sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This term is defined based on dwc:lifeStage (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/lifeStage). Recommended best practice is to use the same controlled vocabulary as for dwc:lifeStage and to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: isLifeStageScopeFullyReported
fields.description: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the life stage scope, and was detected during a dwc:Event, was reported.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the life stage scope and detected during a dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Life stage scope is based on the combination of eco:targetLifeStageScope and eco:excludedLifeStageScope.

fields.name: targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope
fields.description: The degrees of establishment of a dwc:Organisms targeted for sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcdoe/) for dwc:degreeOfEstablishment. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope
fields.description: The degrees of establishment of a dwc:Organisms explicitly excluded from sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcdoe/) for dwc:degreeOfEstablishment. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: isDegreeOfEstablishmentScopeFullyReported
fields.description: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the degree of establishment scope, and was detected during a dwc:Event, was reported.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the degree of establishment scope and detected during a dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Degree of establishment scope is based on the combination of eco:targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope and eco:excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope.

fields.name: targetGrowthFormScope
fields.description: The growth forms or habits of a dwc:Organisms targeted for sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: excludedGrowthFormScope
fields.description: The growth forms or habits of a dwc:Organisms explicitly excluded from sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: isGrowthFormScopeFullyReported
fields.description: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the growth form scope, and was detected during a dwc:Event, was reported.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the growth form scope and detected during a dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Growth form scope is based on the combination of eco:targetGrowthFormScope and eco:excludedGrowthFormScope.

fields.name: hasNonTargetOrganisms
fields.description: One or more dwc:Organisms outside the target organismal scopes (eco:targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope, eco:targetGrowthFormScope, and eco:targetLifeStageScope) were detected and reported for this dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This term is meant to alert users to the presence of non-target organisms (in some disciplines called ‚Äúbycatch‚Äù) reported in this dwc:Event. This term is relevant only if a target organismal scope is declared. Organismal scope is based on the combination of all of the following terms: eco:targetLifeStageScope, eco:excludedLifeStageScope, eco:targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope, eco:excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope, eco:targetGrowthFormScope, and eco:excludedGrowthFormScope. Examination of the organismal scope is needed in order to identify the non-target dwc:Organisms. It should be possible to confirm the expectations by investigating a dwc:Occurrences in this dwc:Event and in its child dwc:Events (if available). The value of this term should be 'true' if dwc:Occurrences of dwc:Organisms outside the organismal scope(s) as defined at the time of a dwc:Event are reported, otherwise the value of this term should be 'false'.

fields.name: verbatimTargetScope
fields.description: The verbatim original description of a dwc:Event scope.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is first to populate explicit scope terms to the fullest extent possible (e.g., eco:targetTaxonomicScope). It is not recommended to use this term in assessing absence or completeness.

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the dwc:Taxon to the subject.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: identifiedByID
fields.description: The identifier for the Agent that asserted the dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to provide a single identifier that disambiguates the details of the identifying agent. If a list is used, the order of the identifiers on the list should not be assumed to convey any semantics. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: identificationReferences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004.`; `Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.`

fields.name: compilationTypes
fields.description: A statement specifying whether data reported are derived from sampling events, ancillary data compiled from other sources, or a combination of both.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event is an inventory. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: compilationSourceTypes
fields.description: The types of data sources contributing to the compilation reported.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event is a compilation in which one or more types of data sources were used. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: inventoryTypes
fields.description: The types of search processes used to conduct the inventory.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event represents an inventory. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: protocolNames
fields.description: Categorical descriptive names for the methods used during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: protocolDescriptions
fields.description: A detailed description of the methods used during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This description should be associated with protocols provided in eco:protocolNames. The description may include deviations from a protocol referred to in eco:protocolReferences. Recommended good practice is to provide information about instruments used, calibration, etc. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
fields.examples: `Three conventional harp traps (3.2m ht x 2.2m w) were established in flight path zones for a period of 4 hrs at dawn and dusk for a total of 10 trap nights. Traps were visited on an hourly basis during each deployment period and the trap catch recorded for species, size, weight, sex, age and maternal status.`

fields.name: protocolReferences
fields.description: The references to the methods used during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
fields.examples: `Penguins from space: faecal stains reveal the location of emperor penguin colonies, https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1466-8238.2009.00467.x`

fields.name: isAbundanceReported
fields.description: The number of dwc:Organisms collected or observed was reported.
fields.comments: Typically the abundance values would be reported in a dwc:organismQuantity and dwc:organismQuantityType terms for the child dwc:Occurrence records for this dwc:Event.

fields.name: isAbundanceCapReported
fields.description: A maximum number of dwc:Organisms was reported, as specified or restricted by the protocol used.
fields.comments: Values of abundance cap should be captured under the term eco:abundanceCap.

fields.name: abundanceCap
fields.description: The reported maximum number of dwc:Organisms.

fields.name: isVegetationCoverReported
fields.description: A vegetation cover metric was reported.
fields.comments: Typically values or descriptions of vegetation cover would be captured under the term eco:verbatimSiteDescriptions.

fields.name: isLeastSpecificTargetCategoryQuantityInclusive
fields.description: The total detected quantity for a dwc:Taxon (including subcategories thereof) in a dwc:Event is given explicitly in a single record (dwc:organismQuantity value) for that dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended values are 'true' and 'false'. This term is only relevant if dwc:organismQuantity is a number. For a detailed explanation, see http://rs.tdwg.org/eco/docs/inclusive/.

fields.name: hasVouchers
fields.description: Specimen vouchers were collected during a dwc:Event.

fields.name: voucherInstitutions
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of the names or acronyms of the institutions where vouchers collected during a dwc:Event were deposited.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

fields.name: hasMaterialSamples
fields.description: Material samples were collected during a dwc:Event.

fields.name: materialSampleTypes
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of material sample types collected during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: samplingPerformedBy
fields.description: A person, group, or organization that performed the sampling.
fields.comments: The sampling dwc:Event could be at any level of hierarchy. In the case of a higher level (parent) dwc:Event, include all the organizations or people involved in the child dwc:Events that contributed to the parent dwc:Event. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `North American Butterfly Association`; `KK Wall`; `JJ Green`; `LL Pink and FF Grey | Aspen Center for Environmental Studies`

fields.name: isSamplingEffortReported
fields.description: The sampling effort associated with a dwc:Event was reported.
fields.comments: Typically values of effort would be captured under the terms eco:samplingEffortValue and eco:samplingEffortUnit.

fields.name: samplingEffortProtocol
fields.description: A description of or reference (publication or URL) to the methods used to determine the sampling effort.
fields.comments: This description should be associated with the values reported in eco:samplingEffortValue and eco:samplingEffortUnit. This is a specialization of eco:protocolDescriptions focused on effort, distinct from the survey method. The effort relates to the intensity of sampling and therefore can assist in interpreting estimates of completeness. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `40 box traps deployed at even spacings along 4 parallel 100m transects placed 50m apart and visited at 6 hourly intervals over a 48 hour period`; `2 people occupying a bird hide for a period of 8 hours and undertaking a 30 minute count of species within the 150 degree field of view every 2 hours`; `A single baited camera trap station with motion sensor trigger, deployed for a period of 10 days and configured for detecting large fauna moving through a known traffic way`

fields.name: samplingEffortValue
fields.description: The numeric value for the sampling effort expended during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This term is meant to capture the total sampling effort value. To express details of how the effort was determined use eco:samplingEffortProtocol. For compilations it is recommend not to infer effort. An eco:samplingEffortValue must have a corresponding eco:samplingEffortUnit.

fields.name: samplingEffortUnit
fields.description: The units associated with the eco:samplingEffortValue.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
